message.content:
cs.AR, cs.ET, cs.SY, cs.DC, cs.PF 

Reasoning: 
- cs.AR (Computer Architecture and Embedded Systems): The paper discusses optimizing a real-time system-on-chip (SoC) and guiding computer architects in the choice of components for the Chip Multiprocessor (CMP), which falls under the scope of computer architecture and embedded systems. 
- cs.ET (Emerging Technologies): The use of convex optimization methods for power optimization in SoCs can be considered an emerging technology in the field of computer engineering. 
- cs.SY (Systems and Control): The paper deals with optimizing a system (SoC) under physical resource-driven constraints, which can be seen as a systems and control problem. 
- cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing): The use of CMPs in the SoC design can be seen as a form of parallel computing, which falls under the scope of distributed, parallel, and cluster computing. 
- cs.PF (Performance): Although the paper focuses on power optimization, it also compares the power optimization results to a conventional performance-optimization framework, which can be seen as a performance-related study.
